sys_metadata_link.payload: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><record_update sys_domain="09ff3d105f231000b12e3572f2b4775d" table="x_415531_rapid_ato_ars_3_1"> <x_415531_rapid_ato_ars_3_1 action="INSERT_OR_UPDATE"> <active>true</active> <activity_due/> <additional_assignee_list/> <approval>not requested</approval> <approval_history/> <approval_set/> <ars_id display_value="ARS 3.1">43903e93dbcd1010280df36f299619aa</ars_id> <assessment_methods_and_objects>Examine: Access control policy; proced</assessment_methods_and_objects> <assessment_objective>Determine if the organization has implemented all elements of this control as described in the control statements and implementation standard(s).  Systems processing, storing, or transmitting PII (to include PHI):  Determine if:(i) The organization de</assessment_objective> <assigned_to/> <assignment_group/> <assurance/> <baseline/> <business_duration/> <business_service/> <calendar_duration/> <close_notes/> <closed_at/> <closed_by/> <cmdb_ci/> <comments/> <comments_and_work_notes/> <company/> <contact_type/> <contract/> <control_definition>The information system maintains the association and integrity of organizationally-defined security attributes to organizationally-defined subjects and objects.  Systems processing, storing, or transmitting PII (to include PHI):  The information system maintains the association and integrity of a. The user attribute of “Annual PII Training” to individuals with access to personally identifiable information (PII); andb. the information attribute of “Contains PII” to applicable information.  Systems processing, storing, or transmitting PHI:  The information system maintains the association and integrity of the information attribute of “Contains PHI” to applicable information.</control_definition> <control_family display_value="Access Control">408779fcdb211010280df36f29961977</control_family> <control_name>Maintenance of Attribute Associations by Information System</control_name> <control_number>AC-16(03)</control_number> <control_type>Non-Mandatory</control_type> <correlation_display/> <correlation_id/> <delivery_plan/> <delivery_task/> <description/> <due_date/> <escalation>0</escalation> <expected_start/> <follow_up/> <group_id>AC-16</group_id> <group_list/> <high>false</high> <impact>3</impact> <implementation_standards/> <knowledge>false</knowledge> <location/> <low>false</low> <made_sla>true</made_sla> <moderate>false</moderate> <number>ARSC0010836</number> <opened_at>2020-06-19 13:21:21</opened_at> <opened_by display_value="System Administrator">6816f79cc0a8016401c5a33be04be441</opened_by> <order/> <parent/> <priority>1</priority> <reassignment_count>0</reassignment_count> <reference_policy>Code: 5 U.S.C. §552a(b) and (e)(10); OMB Circular A-130: 7.g. and Appendix III; 45 C.F.R. §164.310(b)</reference_policy> <rejection_goto/> <related_controls>AC-4, AC-4(15), AC-4(18)</related_controls> <service_offering/> <short_description/> <sla_due/> <standard>NIST-800</standard> <state>1</state> <supplemental_guidance>Maintaining the association and integrity of security attributes to subjects and objects with sufficient assurance helps to ensure that the attribute associations can be used as the basis of automated policy actions. Automated policy actions include, for example, access control decisions or information flow control decisions.  Guidance for systems processing, storing, or transmitting PII (to include PHI):  To use automated systems controls for PII and protected health information (PHI) objects, such as intrusion detection and key-word detection tools, maintaining the association and integrity of security attributes to subjects and objects can be used as the basis of automated policy actions.   Guidance for systems processing, storing, or transmitting PHI:  Implement policies, procedures, and data classification schemas that specify the way the physical, technical, and security attributes of the surroundings of a specific workstation or class of workstation that can access electronic PHI.</supplemental_guidance> <sys_class_name>x_415531_rapid_ato_ars_3_1</sys_class_name> <sys_created_by>admin</sys_created_by> <sys_created_on>2020-06-19 13:21:21</sys_created_on> <sys_domain>09ff3d105f231000b12e3572f2b4775d</sys_domain> <sys_domain_path>!!!/!!!/</sys_domain_path> <sys_id>d087b9fcdb211010280df36f2996192d</sys_id> <sys_mod_count>0</sys_mod_count> <sys_updated_by>admin</sys_updated_by> <sys_updated_on>2020-06-19 13:21:21</sys_updated_on> <task_for/> <time_worked/> <upon_approval>proceed</upon_approval> <upon_reject>cancel</upon_reject> <urgency>3</urgency> <user_input/> <variables/> <watch_list/> <wf_activity/> <work_end/> <work_notes/> <work_notes_list/> <work_start/> </x_415531_rapid_ato_ars_3_1> </record_update>
